etymologies: late Middle English (in an earlier sense). From re- + convention, partly after Middle French reconvention (French reconvention) countercharge, counteraction and post-classical Latin reconventio resummons, countercharge, counteraction, counterpetition

definitions: A countercharge; a counteraction brought against a plaintiff by the defendant in a suit, specifically (Scots Law) the principle of a claimant being liable for counteraction, even if outside the jurisdiction of Scots law. Formerly also in extended use.
The reassembling of a parliament or other legislative body.
